alert.note: Alert for Abbeville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 4:53PM EDT until May 26 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Abbeville County in upstate South Carolina... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms continuing to producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly as locally as much as 3 inches has already fallen. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Honea Path, Calhoun Falls, Due West, Lake Secession, Donalds, Lowndesville, Lake Russell, Lake Strom Thurmond and Antreville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
